text.title: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac

head.s: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac

p.s: This wikiHow teaches you how to monitor your internet speed over time on both PC and a Mac using TestMy.net or Speedcheck .
Both of these tools will let you test your internet bandwidth for free and will work for both Mac and PC users .
Using one of these websites , you 'll be able to monitor changes to your internet speed over minutes , hours , or days , so you can keep up to date on how well your internet is performing .

head.s: Using TestMy.net to Monitor Internet Speed

item.s:
Navigate to the
TestMy website
.
You should be on the automatic speed test page .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 1.jpg

item.s: If you are on the homepage just click on the AutoTest text on at the top of the page .
Click on the circle next to .
This will test your upload and download internet speed .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 2.jpg

item.s: You can test just your upload or download speed by clicking one instead .
Select how long you want to test your internet by clicking on .
For example , you can set it to check your internet speed every 30 minutes .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 3.jpg

item.s: If you set the time to less than 10 minutes the site will ask you to sign up .
Make sure pop-ups are not blocked or the test will be unable to refresh .
Select how often you want the test to repeat by clicking on .
For instance , you can set it to repeat 5 times a day .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 4.jpg

item.s: Click on the button to begin testing your speed .
You can still browse normally on a different tab if you ’d like or you can minimize the window and come back .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 5.jpg

item.s: Your information is not automatically saved unless you create an account .
For longer tests , you cannot turn off your computer even if you create an account .
If you plan on doing a test longer than a day it is recommended that you create an account in case of disconnection issues .
You can end the test early at any time by clicking the button at the top .
Click on the button to see how your internet speed changed .
The graph will average out your speed and display changes over time .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 6.jpg

head.s: Testing Internet Speed Manually with Speedcheck

item.s:
Visit the
Speedcheck website
.
The homepage is where you can begin the test .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 7.jpg

item.s: Decide how long and how often you want to test your net .
You will need to check back in and run tests manually .
You 'll also need to leave your computer on or you can create an account to save your tests .
Create an account by clicking and then in the top-right corner of the page .
Click to begin your internet speed test .
Your data will be saved in your browser so leave your computer on while the tests run .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 9.jpg

item.s: If you created an account you can start the test and turn off your computer after it finishes .
Check your results by clicking the tab .
It will be located at the top-right corner of the page .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 10.jpg

item.s: Run several tests throughout the day to calculate the average speed .
Go back to the tab whenever you want to begin another test .
Having several tests throughout the day will show a better internet speed average under “ History ” .

figure.rend: Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac Step 11.jpg

item.s: If you wanted to test your speed over the week just run the test a few times each day over the week .
In this case , creating an account would be best so you can save your results if the computer shuts off unexpectedly .
